titleStmt.title: Scintilla, or, A light broken into darke warehouses. With observations vpon the monopolists of seaven severall patents, and two charters. Practiced and performed, by a mistery of some printers, sleeping stationers, and combining book-sellers. Anatomised and layd open in a breviat, in which is only a touch of their forestalling and ingrossing of books in pattents, and raysing them to excessive prises. Left to the consideration of the high and honourable House of Parliament now assembled.
titleStmt.author: Sparke, Michael, d. 1653.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: At London, Printed, not for profit, but for the common weles good: and no where to be sold, but some where to be given :

notesStmt.note: Attributed to Michael Sparke. Cf. BM.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
